intro: Sanguisorba officinalis var. serotina, commonly known as late bloodwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with toothed margins and produces small, dark red berries in the autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological landscapes.
